attributes.action: Step Stamp Duty Levels In The Same Way That Income Tax Is Stepped
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: It is grossly unfair that when buying a house at between £125,000 & £250,000, a buyer has to spend 1% in taxes, on the whole sum. The fact that a buyer doesn't have to pay stamp duty on properties below £125,000, should mean that the first £125,000 of any property price should be exempted from this tax. The rest of the tax should be stepped once the various limits are reached.
